articles.headline: Union Workers Back Contract Deals at 3 Big Automakers
articles.snippet: The United Automobile Workers union hopes the agreements with General Motors, Ford and Stellantis will help it make inroads at other companies.
articles.abstract: The United Automobile Workers union hopes the agreements with General Motors, Ford and Stellantis will help it make inroads at other companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Members of the United Automobile Workers union have given their backing to new contracts with the three big U.S. automakers, agreements that deliver hefty wage increases and other gains that had eluded the union for more than 20 years.

articles.headline: Jewish Celebrities and Influencers Confront TikTok Executives in Private Call
articles.snippet: TikTok faces escalating accusations that it promotes pro-Palestinian, anti-Israel content. “Shame on you,” Sacha Baron Cohen said on the call.
articles.abstract: TikTok faces escalating accusations that it promotes pro-Palestinian, anti-Israel content. “Shame on you,” Sacha Baron Cohen said on the call.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than a dozen Jewish TikTok creators and celebrities confronted TikTok executives and other employees in a private meeting on Wednesday night, urging them to do more to address a surge of antisemitism and harassment on the popular video service.

articles.headline: Pressure Mounts as Israel Combs Through Gaza Hospital for Hamas’s Presence
articles.snippet: The Israeli military said troops had uncovered a Hamas tunnel shaft underneath the Al-Shifa Hospital complex, as well as a vehicle on the hospital grounds packed with weapons.
articles.abstract: The Israeli military said troops had uncovered a Hamas tunnel shaft underneath the Al-Shifa Hospital complex, as well as a vehicle on the hospital grounds packed with weapons.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow live news updates on the Israel-Hamas war.
articles.byline: By Patrick Kingsley and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: China Wants to Bulldoze Old Neighborhoods to Revive the Economy
articles.snippet: The halting revitalization of one “urban village” in Shenzhen shows the challenges of fixing a national property crisis after years of overborrowing.
articles.abstract: The halting revitalization of one “urban village” in Shenzhen shows the challenges of fixing a national property crisis after years of overborrowing.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Shenzhen, a metropolis born of China’s economic prosperity, Paibang Village is a reminder of the city’s modest past and the challenges ahead for reviving the country’s property sector.
articles.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi, Claire Fu and Keith Bradsher

articles.headline: A’s Will Finally Turn Out the Lights on Pro Sports in Oakland
articles.snippet: With baseball owners approving the Athletics’ move to Las Vegas, some see the departure as the death of the working-class sports fan.
articles.abstract: With baseball owners approving the Athletics’ move to Las Vegas, some see the departure as the death of the working-class sports fan.
articles.lead_paragraph: One by one, they have left Oakland.

articles.headline: ‘We’ll Never Get Out of Hell’: One American Family’s Escape From Gaza
articles.snippet: Lena Beseiso was visiting family with her children and grandson when the war broke out and thrust them into a fight for survival.
articles.abstract: Lena Beseiso was visiting family with her children and grandson when the war broke out and thrust them into a fight for survival.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lena Beseiso pulled her blanket closer as she lay on the cold tile floor, and waited for the bombs to fall.
articles.byline: By Anna Betts and Vivian Yee
